message:
I hate every queuing system from a debugability point of view. It is just so much harder to find out why something has got stuck if async/await is used or additionally a queue is added. 
A classic example is e.g. if you send data to Chrome over a websocket faster then the browser can process it, it will run Out of Memory. Everything is async and what is working too slow on the incoming messages is very hard to find out given that Chrome uses several processes to do its work. Any queue without backpressure which is blocking the inflow at some point is problematic.
